number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 18, 2015
												This game is just brilliant to play with a group of friends! Sure, the servers are lacking players but I find it more suspenseful when there are fewer players fighting on a massive ship. Basically, this game is like the sims (In that you need to keep your character sociable, well fed & hygienic) mixed with the ability to beat the hell out of other people with canes, umbrellas etc. The ability to throw a weapon is also such a laugh, you can run away from your pursuer sure, but more often than not that just means that they're going to throw a fire axe straight into the back of your head. The good: - Can wear kilts- Can find tommy guns in bedroom drawers (Easy there Michael Corleone) - Can get brutally murdered in the shower/ in your sleep/ while urinating!- There are many different ship maps to play on. (Each map is quite unique) - Range of weapons ranging from a simple umbrella to a winchester rifle :O- The element of suspense (Sure, it's a cartoony game, but when people are chasing you, oh god...)- Requires some form of strategy - The need to find your target & then take them out without any witnesses.- There is a lot of interaction within the game (As stated before, it is like the sims in some ways) - Range of game modes - Elimination, Deathmatch (Just a few examples) & the team varieties. - Well worth the money (Just a decent pick up and play game for the casual gamer)The bad:- Sometimes when the game indicates that there are no nearby witnesses, you get arrested out of the blue. - Going to prison within the game can be a traumatic experience (Don't drop the soap!) - Doesn't seem to be a mode in which you can just kill everyone freely at your leisure (Not good for those who are insane and itching to commit mass murder)The ugly: - The graphics (Don't worry, they don't ruin the fun or the tension of the game) So as you can tell, the game is pretty good. Sure, it isn't amazing, but it isn't to be expected from such a low budget game. However, there can be a lot of funny moments within the game when playing with friends especially. For example, a friend of mine was like 'You come in this room and i'll kill you' to which I merely shot him through the window with my tommy gun. Like I actually needed to go into the room... ;) If you're looking for a game to pick up and play whenever you feel like chasing people with an axe like a rapid lumberjack, this is the game for you!

content:
Posted: October 15, 2015
												So, this game. The Ship: Murder Party. A "Murder mystery" set on a 1920's cruise ship. Very reminiscent of TTT(Trouble in Terrorist Town) a gmod game that is also a "murder mystery"A cartoonish graphical style, time era, and a good atmopshere is somewhere to start with all the good things about this game. Plenty of choice, so diffrent playstyles are possible. Good amount of maps, and it really doesn't get stale ever. There is no "overpowered" strategy to win.  Plenty of funny moments to be had. Good fun.However, no game is perfect. There are also plenty of flaws with this game, mostly in bugs and annoying cameras. Or just getting stuck. The UI and inventory are quite clunky aswell.The game overall is quite good for something of it's age I'll say. Give it a 4.5/5.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2012
												Just as "Zombie Panic: Source" this multiplayer game (there is a singleplayer but I've never played it, it's meant to be a multiplayer title) is more relaxing and fun than most other FPS are. It's not strictly an FPS; though you are playing from the ego-perspective and your goal is to kill your enemies using guns and melee, it has rather simple but gameplay-wise important "needs" to be taken care of by the players one may know from life-simulations like "The Sims".Each player is assigned a specific player to kill when he spawns. You are given his vague position on the ship. You must find him and kill him within a specific time limit with one of many weapons found on the map. Each weapon gives you a different amount of money on kill. If all people kill with the very easily-and-everywhere-found fire axe they won't get much money. So you search all decks and rooms for more rewarding tools, while you constantly must look out not to get stabbed from behind by the player who is supposed to hunt you (which identity you don't know; there are random player models and you can merely guess who is your hunter by paying attention to the behaviour of the players). At the same time you need to take care of common needs like eating, drinking, sleeping and all - which again makes you vulnerable; of course the same applies to your quarry, so waiting for a good chance to get close to him is important. You also need to avoid security guards, cameras and other players serving as "witnesses" - if you don't you are put in the ship jail, losing some money and important time. Sometimes you are lucky/unlucky enough to have your quarry/hunter put in there too; if you find a self-made knife in one of the prison cells that gives you a seldom chance to get rid of him. There are traps on the ships like saunas, lifeboat releases or cooling chambers, but it rarely happens you get to kill your target with those.This basic concept leads to many unique and funny moments. There are other modes like Deathmatch and VIP in which there are two teams who must defend their own VIP and hunt down the one of the opposing team, but those are rarely played. Unfortunately so is the regular hunting mode, because there are almost no servers left to play on. The game was badly advertised and has almost died, if it was ever alive to begin with. There are Steam groups promoting the game and trying to get players to play it, but even that only leads to one or two fully-crowded servers at best.Ubisoft who has or had the rights on the title adapted this hunt-or-be-hunted concept in the Assassin's Creed series. I played the multiplayer of Brotherhood on my PS3 once, and while it was sort of entertaining I didn't get to like it too much. I would still prefer "The Ship". A sequel "Bloody Good Time" in a hollywood/movies scenario was released, but it doesn't look like Outerlight had much more luck with that. They are no more and the rights on "The Ship" apparently went to a company called "Blazing Griffing", who intends to produce a sequel called "The Ship: Full Steam Ahead" (http://www.blazinggriffin.com/the-ship-full-steam-ahead), but only if they get enough support from ordinary people: You can help them fund their so-called "Kickstarter" project here: http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/709089895/the-ship-full-steam-ahead

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												This game is extremely underated.  After the learning curve has been past, this game is highly addictive.  It feels like the game successfully combined the simulation of the Sims, and included it's own bounty twist with weapons.  You spawn in as a hunter in a map that resembles a Cruise ship or resort.  With a randomly generated character, you are hunting another randomly selected player on the map to find and kill with weapons you must find on the map.  The game ends when either the time has run out on the current map, or a player reaches the goal to obtain a certain ammount of money.  To get more money, you kill the other players with weapons, duh.  The weapons variety are fun and interesting, from swords and Winchester rifles, to candlestick holders and poison syringes.  The more recent a weapon was used to kill someone, the less money you will receive from your quarry or bounty.  You lose money if you get caught in attempt to kill the person you are tasked on by a camera and/or another spectator.  As a penalty you are then sent to a jail from 20 to 60 seconds.  While you are on the hunt for that character, which is silhouetted until you talk to them, there are other factors which you must be wary of.  You must care for yourself, meaning you have a few gauges that tell you when you're getting hungry, thirsty, tired, need to use the restroom, are not entertained, and etc.  If you don't care for these needs, you will die or start moving slower, fall asleep in the middle of the room, or deficate on yourself.  You must also care for cameras placed around the map and spectators in the rooms.  To make the game more hectic, if a player kills his quarry/bounty, a timer starts for you to hurry and kill your quarry/bounty.  This causes a panic and makes it so you can't dilly dally.  But be careful, you can't just go on a killing spree and kill every innocent person, you will get kicked by the server and banned for a set time from the server owner.  You also can't go an get careless.  If you continue to get caught, you lose money, and if you lose too much money, you will get kicked and banned from the server on a set timer from the server.  With all these mechanics in play, this game is extremely innovative in many ways.  You feel so rewarded from using weapons that are harder to kill with as they don't get used as often.  Unless you can't get over the graphics department, I highly reccommend this game.  The only thing lacking are the servers.  You can't find any servers and must use a website listing all the servers.  http://www.gameserverdirectory.com/search/the-ship/?page=1&sort=ping_a&game=the-ship For the lazy.9/10 Would definately buy the sequal (if there were ever to be one) at full retail and day one.

content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												I will start by saying the game is fun. It has aged slightly well with the graphics looking like they came from a early PS1 game. I'm not saying this is a bad this necessarily, but it does feel clunky at times. The controls for this game aren't terrible, but they are awkward for some things like opening containers. Before even starting the game I would recommend watching a quick gameplay video, there really isn't a worthwhile tutorial. I haven't logged many hours into this game so I can't talk about the replayability. From what I have played I have enjoyed. The Ship doesn't have any murder mystery solving so don't come in expecting that. It's a unique FPS that I highly recommend. 8.5/10 BigBulge69

content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
												I have a very Love/Hate relationship with this game. I love it, my friends hate it, and I hate a few of my friends when they play it. The premise is that you are a passenger on a cruise ship which is taken over by a mystery villain. He declares that each person on the ship will have a target to hunt, and a hunter who's target is them. This means that you are always being stalked by somebody else as you try to outwit your target and kill them, keeping you on your toes. The suspense is only ever ruined when that target happens to find a Blunderbuss and spends the rest of the game hiding in a cabin and blasting anybody who comes near them.My group picked this game up on a good sale and we enjoyed playing it despite the cabin camper in our midst. It was entertaining trying to hunt down our friends and outwit our hunters. But at the end of the day we had a few people who took the game a little too seriously and some hateful words were said. Taken with a lot of salt The Ship is a wonderful game for every now and then. But it's definitely not for everybody.

												Great game! Fantastic content! The single player mode has a good but not the best storyline. If you like murder or murder parties you'll like this!When i played i felt a little like i was playing Bioshock Infinite cause of how the people looked and how they over-exaggerate their deaths. Such as flying bodies or last words. The weapons are believable to the time that this game takes place and it really takes you to the late 1800s with the music, atmosphere and realism.If you decide to buy this game don't think of this as a hard competition or how this is a to the grave drop-dead ..."AMAZING" gameMake history yours.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												The gameplay alone is amazing.  The entire concept of having to be on board a ship full of murderers including yourself makes this rich, as well as having it very well balanced.  the fact that it adds many variables that you need to keep in check on top of killing adds difficulty and immersion to the game, and there's many opportunities for you to kill people as well as get killed. It's splendid and I'd recommend it if you can play LAN with a couple friends. My only gripe is the fact that there are no more dedicated servers to host multiplayer matches.  I hate this because playing with real people makes it more intense as you need to think who may be a real person or an AI, and it's a lot more fun to kill someone knowing they'll have a reaction.  On top of that; the games AI isn't very smart either.  They'll hardly ever attack you, or sometimes it's easy to know that they're hunting you. Still it's a great game and with how cheap it is with sales it's worth it for the experience.

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												After finding this game on sale through Steam for four bucks, the decision to pick it up (along with two free gift copies) was a no-brainer.  It’s a bit like “Clue” in that the mysterious Mr. X has invited a bunch of people to embark on a cruise…but things get ugly when you learn that cash is rewarded to people who manage to murder their targets.  Guards and cameras exist to keep people from going homicidal, as well as a full-fledged jail for anyone caught breaking the rules. On top of being sneaky, you’ll have needs to meet like in “The Sims”…thirst, social, that kind of thing. The game does support AI…in fact the game comes with three different game modes: Tutorial, Single Player, and Multiplayer.  It’s best to try out the tutorial first, followed by the single player. Once you manage to get past those, you’ll find that there are a few in-game modes available: Hunt and Elimination.  Hunt uses a timer to mark the length of rounds while rounds in elimination ends with the last person standing.  It takes getting used to, but overall I found it to be a lot of fun.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												DO NOT LISTEN TO ANYONE! THIS GAME IS NOT DEAD! The default in game servers are dead yes. But the game is far from dead. To access the servers just go to view - servers - and then select 'The Ship' in the games tab. The Ship is about a crazy man only known as 'Mr. X' who threatens all the passengers that their families will be killed if they don't play his game. That's where you come in. You will be randomly generated as someone and your task is to find weapons and kill your target. Each weapon will get you a certain amount of money and once the weapon is used...it's borderline useless unless you wish to defend yourself with it. For such a simple game it's pretty in depth. You have needs you must take care of while killing your targets/avoiding your hunters. Which makes it more interesting. You win by having the most money. The amount of kills and deaths do not matter. I got killed many times and came out on top with just one kill with a very high money grabbing weapon in one match.  The two cons to this game are:1. If you don't have a weapon you are completely defenseless. You can't use your hands other than to push.2. People can block you in rooms and hallways making half the game about just trying to move a couple of inches at a time or just waiting for a loser to back away so you can exit through a door. It can get frustrating.Pros (yeah it's weird starting with cons but there was less to say...good thing right?):A cool mix of 'The Sims' and 'Assassins Creed Multiplayer' with a goofy twistA quick jail system for when you get caught (great way to get all your needs done for free in one small area)Diverse weapons"Discovering" who people are. Talk to them to have an easier time knowing who to kill and where they are.Diverse maps (No there isn't just ship maps. I've been in a blimp map (which was horrible), a house map and a dock/tropical island map)Overall, this game is small but really in depth and addicting. I was gifted this game but I would easily have paid for it. My only original doubt was that the game was dead. And it most certainly isn't. 9/10

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												I got this game a while back while watching a stream and playing with the streamer + 10 other viewers on TS. This game is rlly a lot of fun and even though i ignored it a bit due to the server not showing issue i have been playing this quite frequently again. Basically you´re given a target wich u need to hunt down while killing it with an object ranging ffrom an umbrella to a machinegun. The idea is to not get caught by the camera's or guards doing it else u will get arrested [wich u can get killed in there as well if ur unlucky] prety simple right? Wrong not only is there a time limit to it but the object u kill the target with based on the object kill list [highest ranked object gives most cash] matters and u have to deal with hunger, thirst, sleep, hygiene and the occasional toilet visits as well to keep ur character from dying. And the biggest treath is that you are beign HUNTED as well :O. So kill ur target and escape from ur killer till timer runs out and gratz u won the first time now try to get on top of the list till u win the whole round] I highly recommend playing the tutorial first as it rlly gives u a idea on how everything works[takes like 10mins max] .  If u can get past that i wil guarantee u will have a fun time wether playing solo or with friends.

number of helpful: 7 of 15 people (47%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 3
												The ship is a very interesting idea for the game. It has potential to be somehting GREAT. When you buy this game, you will find three new games in your library (The Ship, The Ship Single Player, The Ship Tutorial) - I will go over each one.The Ship is the heart and soul of the game, and is what could be amazing about it. Basically, all the players have a "mark" on one of the other players, but nobody knows who you're hunting which can provide interesting scenarios. To spice things up, you cannot kill or even bear a weapon while being watched by civilians, guards or cameras. This means, you could lure a potential hunter into a trap! This sense of an almost "stalemate" makes things very interesting and with enough dedicated players could make this one of the most interesting and enjoyable games here. The problem is, the servers are down so you have to manually join servers - not too big a hassle, but it is definitely inconvenient, especially when trying to play with friends. Also, from what I've seen, not too many active player hosted servers.I expected the Ship Single player to be the same as online except with bots - essentially be a "training area" for noobies. It is instead, a very short campaign with no options to play "multiplayer except with bots" unfortnately. Like I said, the campaign is very short, it is unrewarding, has annoying voice acting and is terribly unrewarding. The "levels" if you want to call them that can be too easy or ridiculously unfair out of nowehere. The most annoying part is one slip up (even if just caught with a weapon) all the progress yo made in that level is restarted, which means more walking across the ship to talk to the annoying sounding characters. Campaign can be beaten in about 1 to 2 hours depending on how fast you are at it, and if you want to "role play" or not. The game also has really annoying mechanics. You have various needs sor tof like a sim game, which would be fine, if they didn't randomly have to be upkept every two seconds. The most annoying is the "sprinting" in this game, which is the alternative to walking very slowly. The so called "sprinting" is tremendously slow and runs out of energy almost immediately. You get about 2 seconds max at sprinting to then have to wait for about 10+ seconds before you can do it again. The killing animations are hilarious, so killing other players is the highlight of the game, to be honest, which seems to be lacking in variety in the campaign - hence why the multiplayer could be so good!The tutorial is short lasting, covers all the mechanics of the game and is pretty important to "play" just to make sure you know what you're doing. Why the three games weren't integrated as one, I'll never know. The tutorial speaker, however, talks incredibly slow and waits long amounts of time before going on to the next thing she needs to say - this gets annoying very fast.I know it sounds like I am just complaining about the game - which hoenstly my review is mostly that. With that said it is not a terrible game and when on sale for 5$ I think this is one everyone should pick up. BUT PLEASE PUT THE SERVERS BACK UP DEVS. This game has gret potential and I know it can be enjoyable despite the annoyances. At its current state, however, I cannot recommend it.+GREAT potential in multiplayer+Funny killing animations-Outdated graphics-Annoying mechanics (read review)-Servers not up in-game

												I received a low-threat prisoner, so I didn't pay much attention to him. How wrong I was..It was a normal, average day. The prisoners were eating their lunch.. then it happened.He attacked from the shadows.Prisoner "Leeroy jenkins" viciously started stabbing my guards with his plastic fork. It was 5 against one.He'll never win, I thought.He'll never escape, I thought.He'll never survive, I thought.I thought wrong.He managed to start a full-scale riot, him and his army of offenders. They broke all 7 of my steel doors with their bare fists, escaping into the yard. They were almost out. I quickly hired God-knows-how-many dog handlers, in a valiant effort to hold them back until the authorities get here. I managed to keep the tsunami of prisoners back, put the prison on lockdown and finally the armed police got here.I did it, I stopped the riot.But then I saw that one particular cell was empty. Then I realized..LEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEROOOOOOOOOOOY JEEEENKINS!54/11 would plastic fork again.

content:
Posted: April 7, 2014
												The Ship is an incredibly fun game ! And it really is fun - it is not the victory of each round that makes it fun, it is the actual gameplay! - if you win it is just "hey, I won". It is not the victory, but the gameplay, that makes this game worth playing - you can easily spend 2-4 hours playing it. I did try to up the resolution to 1600x900, but then some of the fun went away - it the characters are a bit pointy, it makes the game more fun, more cartoonish you might say.The Ship is a fantastisc game, no doubt about that, and it is really worth buying! the singleplayer part is both short and a bit boring, but the multiplayer part is so much fun!A must buy!

content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
												A wonderful idea for an FPS - you are set to kill a single person, but you have no idea who is out to kill you. However, the main server is down and you have to work around to find a server - which usually only has one or two proper players on, and while playing with computers is fun, they can sometimes be a bit stupid. Still, it is very fun, especially having to keep track of all your character's needs, so it is worth buying.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												I saw Nerdcubed play it, asked a friend if I could get a copy, and he gave me one.It was not a mistake installing this game. Story - 2/5You are on a ship, (duh) lost at sea. You are hundreds of miles away from your last recorded position, and a villan as set up a little game. People are hunting eachother, in an attempt to be the last person standing. No real story other then that, the meat of this game is in the gameplay. Gameplay - 5/5You have a variate of weapons to complete your goals. (I.e, killing your target.) Axes, walletbombs, shanks, e.t.cIn the standard gamemode, you have a target, and you are targeted by someone. In a certain amount of time, you must kill your target without being killed or caught. You also have needs, such as bathing, eating, using the restroom, e.t.c. Its both fun playing with bots, and online.Multiplayer - 5/5Look at gameplay and story, but with your friends.Trust no one.AI - 4/5The AI is a bit questionable. You can easily find your hunter by watching them run at you, (Straight at you.)They often can get stuck behind doors, and dont often fight back. Extra -All the weapons are extremely well made for certain situations. Got a long hallway without anything to catch you? Use a axe or other blunt weapon. Need to set a quick trap? Use a wallet bomb. Have a short space, and need to quickly kill your target? Use posion, or a sleep syringe and a quick melee attack.Extremely fun on multiplayer and singleplayer.Would I recommend?Of course.Overal rating -4/5

content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
												The ship is a great game. I enjoy it more with friends. The situations where your quarry is in prison, and your'e waiting outside the door, waiting to pounce, when suddenly, your hunter jumps in with a blunderbuss and blows your guts all over the outside of the release office, and the cops don't notice, because your hunter isn't in the cameras view. There is just pure satisfaction when you find a tommy gun on the closet, or the teasing, agonizing feeling that you get when your quarry is right next to you, but there are too many witnesses. The "needs" system is a great addition, but it's really annoying when you pass out or waz yourself right behind your quarry. (9.5/10)

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
												The tutorial is wonderfully made.A well laid out how to play and suggestions both fro single and multiplayer.Single playerThe storyline was well linked, though I think the map being player oriented would have made it easier to navigate.The quarry was too easy to find to me, and i never encountered my own hunter so it didnt feel so much as a deathmatchMultiplayer/ArcadeArcade mode was the best to me, the NPCs weren't very easy to beat  and made for a better game. Did not appreciate when kept being arrested for pulling out my weapon in an empty bathroom.as for multiplayer i am so disapointed. I live just north of Venezuela and i have no access to any games.Even if i leave all the options open I don't see any online games, nor can find a way to join any games. i bought this games with the sole intent to play online and that is the one thing i cannot do. i have checked on multiple occasions just in case there was maintenance an there is no change at all. Would not recommend unless you have friends that can play on WLAN with you

content:
Posted: July 15, 2012
												The Ship is one of those games you just don't know what to do with. It's a stratagy game at it's core. You are given a quary (either another player or computer) and someone is hunting you (player/PC). You must explore the various ships to find weapons and kill your quary without getting caught. Sounds pretty simple, right? Well toss in the "needs" mechanic very popular with The Sims series, this requires you to find food, bathe, sleep, socialize, and entertain yourself. As long as you have a group of friends to play it with, this is a very interesting game with a hystarical soundtrack based in the 20's.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												The Ship is one of the most interesting multiplayer games I've played. Instead of running around and killing everyone, you're tasked with tracking down a single opponent (and avoiding the player who is out for you), all the while taking care of your personal needs, such as sleeping and eating. What results is a tense, exciting game with a great atmosphere of paranoia. Is that guy after me or just passing by? The gameplay encourages you to switch up your tactics by giving a higher payout for using certain weapons (the winner at the end is the player with the most money), and there are times when forgoing hunting down your enemy in order to track down a good weapon are in order. If I had one complaint about this game, it would be that the ships in the game have many narrow corridors, causing annoying traffic jams. With that said, The Ship is a unique, interesting game you should seek out. The playerbase isn't huge, but there's always enough people to have a decent game.

content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
												A wonderful idea for an FPS - you are set to kill a single person, but you have no idea who is out to kill you. However, the main server is down and you have to work around to find a server - which usually only has one or two proper players on, and while playing with computers is fun, they can sometimes be a bit stupid. Still, it is very fun, especially having to keep track of all your character's needs, so it is worth buying.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2014
												I saw Nerdcubed play it, asked a friend if I could get a copy, and he gave me one.It was not a mistake installing this game. Story - 2/5You are on a ship, (duh) lost at sea. You are hundreds of miles away from your last recorded position, and a villan as set up a little game. People are hunting eachother, in an attempt to be the last person standing. No real story other then that, the meat of this game is in the gameplay. Gameplay - 5/5You have a variate of weapons to complete your goals. (I.e, killing your target.) Axes, walletbombs, shanks, e.t.cIn the standard gamemode, you have a target, and you are targeted by someone. In a certain amount of time, you must kill your target without being killed or caught. You also have needs, such as bathing, eating, using the restroom, e.t.c. Its both fun playing with bots, and online.Multiplayer - 5/5Look at gameplay and story, but with your friends.Trust no one.AI - 4/5The AI is a bit questionable. You can easily find your hunter by watching them run at you, (Straight at you.)They often can get stuck behind doors, and dont often fight back. Extra -All the weapons are extremely well made for certain situations. Got a long hallway without anything to catch you? Use a axe or other blunt weapon. Need to set a quick trap? Use a wallet bomb. Have a short space, and need to quickly kill your target? Use posion, or a sleep syringe and a quick melee attack.Extremely fun on multiplayer and singleplayer.Would I recommend?Of course.Overal rating -4/5

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
												The tutorial is wonderfully made.A well laid out how to play and suggestions both fro single and multiplayer.Single playerThe storyline was well linked, though I think the map being player oriented would have made it easier to navigate.The quarry was too easy to find to me, and i never encountered my own hunter so it didnt feel so much as a deathmatchMultiplayer/ArcadeArcade mode was the best to me, the NPCs weren't very easy to beat  and made for a better game. Did not appreciate when kept being arrested for pulling out my weapon in an empty bathroom.as for multiplayer i am so disapointed. I live just north of Venezuela and i have no access to any games.Even if i leave all the options open I don't see any online games, nor can find a way to join any games. i bought this games with the sole intent to play online and that is the one thing i cannot do. i have checked on multiple occasions just in case there was maintenance an there is no change at all. Would not recommend unless you have friends that can play on WLAN with you

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
This is what I really wanted from 'The Ship'!The original single-player game is a pain in the drain! I could never kill that dude before he wacked the old guy in the wheelchair (and who cares?!)'The Ship: Murder Party' finally puts things in order! Now, single-player is simply offline-with-bots - just like CS, baby! And it works GREAT! TONS OF FUN!!!Originally posted by Redey59:"The master server is down, so the new way of joining servers is by "searching" for em, though there are probably more site's that do this, the 1 i use is http://www.gameserverdirectory.com/search/the-ship/After doing that, you can choose between servers, click on 1 of those server names.If done correctly you should see a green line of numbers at the top left, copy that line.Then, inside "The Ship" you need to activate the devolper console. (its the same as in all other half-life 2 games so feel free to skip this part if you know how to enable it already)-Go to "Engine Room" (this is the "options" menu here)-Select Keyboard-Select Advanced-tick "enable developer console" onNow, back to the reason why you copy'd that line of numbers a while earlier, press on the ` key (this is to the left of the "1"/Under escape/Above tabYou should see a box pop up, in this box type :Connect "the line of numbers"i.eConnect 789.489.495.228;27015Now you are on your way to a multiplayer server :)Thanks for reading, i made this guide becouse i want to avoid the massive amount of questions at the "disccussions" tab, which is why there are not any strategies or tips here.Edit: you can also go to the "favorites" tab in the server browser and then press "add server", if you type the IP there it will stay there forever, removing the entire process of going to the site and such. (thanks for the tip: Flaming Waffle and Tyrak)Edit2: You can also look at all available servers in the steam client by going to: View > Servers > Change the filter for "Game" into "The ship", this will then also show a list, rightclicking on a server and then looking at its server info will then give you the IP of that server."THIS IS COOL: at one point, I decided to play as a passenger, so I could just get a look and feel for the game. As a 'passenger' rather than a 'hunter', I couldn't carry weapons (and you can be killed) but I had freedom to explore the maps and then discovered that you are basically a mobile security cam! For over an hour, I followed 'hunter players' around, freaking them out and faking them out (they don't know who's after them). If they do something whle you're watching they go to jail. One dude didn't play that and wacked me fast. I was laughing my a$$ off (which is dangerous since I don't have much to begin with)!!!10/10 would get viciously killed acting a fool, again!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												A word of warning for those looking to play this game online. The servers don't show up by default. There are servers but you have to search for them by entering the IP Address under the favorites tab or by using the console.That being said, there is still singleplayer and arcade mode. Arcade mode is simply multiplayer but with bots. The AI isn't that good at hunting though. I've gone whole matches with no deaths and I highly doubt it's MY skill that's keeping me alive but the bot's lack of skill. The game itself has the potential to be fun but, alas, there's just no way to play with anyone else with the servers offline. If new servers ever come online, I imagine there'd be a nice and steady swarm of people lining up to join in.

content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
												The ship is a great game. I enjoy it more with friends. The situations where your quarry is in prison, and your'e waiting outside the door, waiting to pounce, when suddenly, your hunter jumps in with a blunderbuss and blows your guts all over the outside of the release office, and the cops don't notice, because your hunter isn't in the cameras view. There is just pure satisfaction when you find a tommy gun on the closet, or the teasing, agonizing feeling that you get when your quarry is right next to you, but there are too many witnesses. The "needs" system is a great addition, but it's really annoying when you pass out or waz yourself right behind your quarry. (9.5/10)

(its the same as in all other half-life 2 games so feel free to skip this part if you know how to enable it already)-Go to "Engine Room" (this is the "options" menu here)-Select Keyboard-Select Advanced-tick "enable developer console" onNow, back to the reason why you copy'd that line of numbers a while earlier, press on the ` key (this is to the left of the "1"/Under escape/Above tabYou should see a box pop up, in this box type :Connect "the line of numbers"i.eConnect 789.489.495.228;27015Now you are on your way to a multiplayer server :)Thanks for reading, i made this guide becouse i want to avoid the massive amount of questions at the "disccussions" tab, which is why there are not any strategies or tips here.Edit: you can also go to the "favorites" tab in the server browser and then press "add server", if you type the IP there it will stay there forever, removing the entire process of going to the site and such. (thanks for the tip: Flaming Waffle and Tyrak)Edit2: You can also look at all available servers in the steam client by going to: View > Servers > Change the filter for "Game" into "The ship", this will then also show a list, rightclicking on a server and then looking at its server info will then give you the IP of that server."THIS IS COOL: at one point, I decided to play as a passenger, so I could just get a look and feel for the game. As a 'passenger' rather than a 'hunter', I couldn't carry weapons (and you can be killed) but I had freedom to explore the maps and then discovered that you are basically a mobile security cam! For over an hour, I followed 'hunter players' around, freaking them out and faking them out (they don't know who's after them). If they do something whle you're watching they go to jail. One dude didn't play that and wacked me fast. I was laughing my a$$ off (which is dangerous since I don't have much to begin with)!!!10/10 would get viciously killed acting a fool, again!

												A word of warning for those looking to play this game online. The servers don't show up by default. There are servers but you have to search for them by entering the IP Address under the favorites tab or by using the console.That being said, there is still singleplayer and arcade mode. Arcade mode is simply multiplayer but with bots. The AI isn't that good at hunting though. I've gone whole matches with no deaths and I highly doubt it's MY skill that's keeping me alive but the bot's lack of skill. The game itself has the potential to be fun but, alas, there's just no way to play with anyone else with the servers offline. If new servers ever come online, I imagine there'd be a nice and steady swarm of people lining up to join in.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												How do you make a game with this much potential, then fail to fix the easy stuff that would allow people to actually play it?I like this game and it does have great potential, and that makes the disappointment that much worse. Developers: why are the simplest of things broken? Seriously. First of all, the single player campaign is not worth the money. It is far too short. Secondly, good luck getting into a multiplayer game with other people. You can't join a server from in-game. This seemingly simple mechanism is broken and apparently the developers could are less to address it (as evidenced by long threads complaining about it). I figured out that you can actually retrieve a server list within steam, which had me excited right up until every single server in the list returned a "server not responding" error message. I have tried to get into a game for 3 days now and I'm hanging it up at this point. With so many great games on steam, dont' waste your time on this one.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2015
												The ship is one of these games that you should consider owning simply because it is such a classic title. It is starting to show a little bit of it's age but the cartoony style helps.This is basically the multiplayer game equivalent of a murder party turned FPS game, you only have one quarry per round, but knowing that someone is after you and that it is the only other person that you may kill without repercussion adds a healthy dose of paranoya to the mix.The game throws in a fair bit of deception too, change clothes to lose the trail of your killer, the maps are rigged with a few original traps and secret passages, And there are a few tools for the crafty players, such as sleeping drugs and wallet bombs.There are maps of various sizes that will accomodate a good variety of players (unlike a lot of games this is sort of important on the ship) and it also has "passenger bot support" which can help to add a "bulk" of innocents if you lack in player volume. Bots can also be hunters but they are pretty poor at this job.

Whats even worse is that the only alternative is a buggy remastered version with donald trump in it, who the f** wants to see donald trump in a game? The developers have been really cheeky and offered this alternative for a hefty price, with no discount or compensation for current owners of the ship:murder party!

content:
Posted: December 8, 2010
												Want to be an assassin on a boat that is far away from shore with all hands on board? Then this game is right for you. The game takes place in a boat that is not coming back to shore any time soon, and you are forced to play a game that you have become the hunted and the hunter. You have to track down your quarry and try to avoid the person that's his or her quarry. AND THAT'S YOU! After a few moments you now have to take care of your needs, which means you are in a Sims game (Sims is a game where your trying to take care of your family) and you have to take a bath, eat something, drink something, talk to people, go to the bathroom, have some fun, just about you would do to take care of yourself. Sure, you going to have to deal with this every time you play this game. But, don't worry, there's different game modes if you don't want to play hunter. This is like tag and hide and seek mixed to together. Only, your try to kill each other.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
												I have been playing Tiger Woods '08 PC on a regular basis since it came out back in 2007. No modern game has come close. That is until this game was released. The graphics are top notch and very realistic. The addition of trees and bushes since last year improved the visuals a great deal. The graphic improvements will no doubt continue in the future with the possible addition of 3D blades of grass using Nvidia’s graphics technology.Online play is great with turn based multiplayer and the ability to play with up to 8 players. You can stop and resume your round at a later time. There are loads of different play modes available. If tournaments are your thing you can participate in many online. The game also has a cool replay feature that allows you to watch the last round from a number of different angles. Your opponent(s) can see the replays as well.Another big plus for the game is the freecam mode. Take a virtual tour of the entire game from every conceivable angle and soak in the wonderful immersion that this game provides.This game has lived up to its potential. Every update over the last year has shown improvement, especially the most recent update from last month. This community driven game will only get better in the months and years to come. Be sure to give it a try and you won't be disappointed.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												The ship comes with both a singleplayer mode and a multiplayer mode but both are rather lacking. The singleplayer mode introduces you to the games basic mechanics but unintresting storyline and repetitive gameplay are not enough to make the game enjoyable. One problem I had with the game was that if you die you have to restart the level from the beginning rather than from the last objective. This led me to doing some chapters multiple times because they are long and I would end up dying near the end. The map is incoviently large and many times you have to spend most of the time just wandering around looking for where you're going.The multiplayer is not that great either. You cannot use the game to find servers and you have to do something complicated in the steam browser in order to find one. The multiplayer has a good concept- every player has someone to kill and someone who wants to kill them- but a lot of time it is hard enough to find the person that you are looking for, much less kill them. If you are playing with friends then the game might be more intresting but the game does not bring enough to the table to be something worth reccomending.Pros*Intresting Concept*More to the game than just killing( you need to manage hunger and cleanliness, etc.)*Whenyou buy it it gives you copies to send to your friends.Cons*Repetitive*It is too hard to find your way around the boat*Hard to find servers*Not very intresting

												The ship comes with both a singleplayer mode and a multiplayer mode but both are rather lacking. The singleplayer mode introduces you to the games basic mechanics but unintresting storyline and repetitive gameplay are not enough to make the game enjoyable. One problem I had with the game was that if you die you have to restart the level from the beginning rather than from the last objective. This led me to doing some chapters multiple times because they are long and I would end up dying near the end. The map is incoviently large and many times you have to spend most of the time just wandering around looking for where you're going.The multiplayer is not that great either. You cannot use the game to find servers and you have to do something complicated in the steam browser in order to find one. The multiplayer has a good concept- every player has someone to kill and someone who wants to kill them- but a lot of time it is hard enough to find the person that you are looking for, much less kill them. If you are playing with friends then the game might be more intresting but the game does not bring enough to the table to be something worth reccomending.Pros*Intresting Concept*More to the game than just killing( you need to manage hunger and cleanliness, etc.)*Whenyou buy it it gives you copies to send to your friends.Cons*Repetitive*It is too hard to find your way around the boat*Hard to find servers*Not very intresting

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												The Ship is a relatively entertaining game, but is plagued by many flaws.It came out a while ago - 2006, in fact, and it does show its age, unfortunately. It's "old-school", but not in a nice way. It all feels just a little bit clunky and laboured while playing it, and that just wouldn't be tolerated if it came out today.Onto the game itself. I'll address the singleplayer first and foremost - it's pretty short and only lasts about an hour or two. It is intended to prepare you for the multiplayer, the main part of the game, but it's rather ineffective in doing so. You're never placed into a situation you would actually face in the multiplayer - mostly it's a case of go here, talk to this person, kill this guy, rinse and repeat (leaving out the occassional other trivial act). It doesn't help that the singleplayer is very frustrating at points and feels lazily done. To be honest, there's no real point in playing it.Now, the multiplayer. If you're reading this, I assume you understand the whole concept of the game. The concept does seem extremely entertaining. However, it's not executed as well as you would like. The maps are all too small for 24-32 players like the very few servers remaining are and you often find yourself cramped in rooms, getting blocked in corridors etc. The inclusion of security is poorly done - guards, cameras and witnesses seem to be just about everywhere meaning you rarely ever find a good opportunity to take out your quarry. You look to take out your target, only to realise there's a camera watching and you're arrested for pulling out your weapon. The needs system becomes tedious quickly - I can't be bothered going to the toilet or sleeping when I'm avoiding my hunter and searching for my quarry. You also only have 90 seconds for each round to kill your quarry, which is nowhere nearly enough time. The jail system is another major flaw in the game also - if you kill your quarry, you can deliberately get yourself arrested so as to be protected from the person hunting you. This can then also be undermined by your hunter deliberately putting themselves into jail and seeing if they can get the shank to take you out. There are plenty of other examples of things like this that just make you think "That could have been done so much better".It doesn't help that quite a number of people who play the game run around like headless chickens killing on sight as they are suspicious of anyone around them. Your enjoyment of this game is almost entirely based around other people and how they act - and when they act like they often do, it ruins it.And I still haven't mentioned the obvious yet - the game is pretty much dead. Servers are mainly filled with bots rather than players. The developers, Outerlight, don't even exist anymore so hopes of changes are nonexistent. However, there's a sequel on Greenlight that looks like it could be very good. Perhaps I'm not giving the game enough credit - it is relatively fun...for 15 to 20 minute periods. Then the same old flaws appear again and again and you just want to go and play something else. It's a real shame, because if this game had been much, much more polished and it had an active community these days I would have tons of fun with it. I got it for 70p on Bundlestars, and I don't really mind at that price. Let's hope for more in the sequel.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2015
												Enjoyable... with a disclaimer.This game is very enjoyable, with a great art style and a fun concept: a bunch of people on a cruise-ship together must get weapons and battle each other to the death for a huge cash-prize.Sadly this game is not all roses and tommy-guns.One of the biggest flaws with this game is the 'mood' system, which feels like it was copy-pasted from 'The Sims', and shoehorned horribly into this game. The problem with it is that you must constantly maintain numerous personal issues like hunger, thirst, bladder, tiredness, etc... or else you will fall over dead. The big problem with this though is that it's so easy to cause these issues to spike, like how killing people makes you nervous and you need to talk to people to feel better, which is smart... but if you're in the middle of a cluster♥♥♥♥ of gunfire, and you kill too many people, your anxiety will skyrocket, you'll be frozen in place while your character has themselves a little crying break, leaving you open to any and all attacks for at least ten seconds.Overall the game is enjoyable, but it certainly has problems, and I mean MAJOR problems. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone on the basis that it takes a specific kind of person to enjoy it, so be sure you don't waste money on this game and instead find a friend who has it, and play their copy for a while.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
												If you are actively trying to play this game in multiplayer, you are going to be immensely let down. The object is to  find and kill your target, all while evading your own pursuer; however, because this game is multiplayer, you are quite often going to walk into a room and get murdered because these are other people you are playing against and don't actually feel like playing a game. Essentially what this game comes down to is if you find a gun, you win the game because you can back away into an unobserved corner and kill anyone that even walks into the same area as you, or you are going to get murdered by someone who is neither your target nor your pursuer. This game has potential, but because this being played by other people, the entire fun and novelty is destroyed.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
												(This review was updated from its initial version to indicate that the game can be played via the Steam server browser. I still would not recommend the game right now because it's just too difficult to find a good server populated by humans instead of bots.)The Ship's core gameplay is interesting and fun for short bursts (now that I got it to work), but sadly the multiplayer community is almost nonexistent. This is probably because the in-game server browser is completely dead, and apparently the developers can't update their game at all because of licensing restrictions.A workaround using Steam's server browser is available (Steam Client > View > Servers > set filters for The Ship)) but it is clunky, unreliable, and has to be reset each time you start Steam.But even using that, there are barely any servers populated by real humans. Most are filled with bots. Of the 3 populated servers I could find, there were 10 total humans online. I've joined games where after a few rounds, all the people had left and I was left with all bots again. It's a sad state of affirs.I also didn't realize how old the game was (2006) when I bought it on a Steam sale in late 2014. It probably would've been a lot more fun in its heyday, with a fuller and more vibrant community.As it is, it might be worth it the pick the title up on sale for a few online rounds (if you're lucky), or if you have a few friends who are for sure into it, but otherwise I wouldn't bother unless they fix the multiplayer. It's fun, just not worth the headaches, IMO.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												So my friend saw this game on sale and it looked really awesome, the concept of the game sounded really cool.We even rushed to get Steam Wallet money when the sale of the game was supposed to end (Saturday) cause we were that exited to get it.We bought 4 copies of the game, and gifted the other 2 to our other friends.That's another thing to add to my list of regrets..The game's dead, bland, and boring.I imagined it was fun before, like a few months ago when it was apperently big.But now it basically feels lifelless.- Servers are practically empty- The game feels lifeless.- With friends it might be fun, but only for a really short period of time- I cannot imagine anyone playing this game for more than an hour.- To go online (Since the devs are done with the game) you have to go through Steam > View > Servers. which is way too much of a hassle.- It's not worth it, even on sale- IT WILL DISSAPOINT YOU, I can promise thatThankfully there's Steam Refunds :D~ Got all 4 games refunded :D~ But the time wasted... that's forever gone.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2012
												The ship is unique in how many titles have taken from it in recent years. The gist is you have to assassinate another player on the map. The trick is that every character (including you) look very similar to all the NPCs on the map. Your also avoiding assassination yourself from another player.One of the recent Assassins Creed games took this concept almost verbatim, and it's likely more will follow suite. However while comparing The Ship on it's own merts it doesn't stand up any longer. The game hasn't aged well and it's community is long since extinct. It stands a curious piece of history from a bygon age of modding.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2016
												This game is okay if you have some friends to play it with....here's a recipe for pancakes, enjoy!Ingredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs, at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.INGREDIENTS:1. 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided2. 1 onion, diced3. 1 pound ground beef4.1 pound ground pork5. 1/2 cup Panko*6. 2 large egg yolks7. 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice8. 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg9 .Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to tasteFOR THE GRAVY1. 1/4 cup unsalted butter2. 1/3 cup all-purpose flour3. 4 cups beef broth4. 3/4 cup sour cream5. Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste6. 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley leavesDIRECTIONS:1. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, and cook, stirring frequently, until onions have become translucent, about 2-3 minutes.2. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground pork, Panko, egg yolks, allspice, nutmeg and cooked onion; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Using a wooden spoon or clean hands, stir until well combined. Roll the mixture into 1 1/4-to-1 1/2-inch meatballs, forming about 24 meatballs.3. Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the skillet. Add meatballs, in batches, and cook until all sides are browned, about 4-5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.4. To make the gravy, melt butter in the skillet. Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Gradually whisk in beef broth and cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 1-2 minutes. Stir in sour cream; season with salt and pepper, to taste.5. Stir in meatballs and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through and thickened, about 8-10 minutes.6. Serve immediately, garnished with parsley, if desired.*Panko is a Japanese-style breadcrumb and can be found in the Asian section of your local grocery store.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												Don't let the hours I have spent on this game fool you. My account freaked out and no matter what I did, it just said I was in game for 60 hours straight. I really only spent about an hour in single player mode in this game, mostly because my multiplayer won't work for this game, which is a bummer. Multiplayer might be quite fun for this game, but this isn't multiplayer. This is single player.It's not that interesting. Kill people on a boat, and try to not get killed by someone else that's going after you. It'd be great for 10 bucks, but for 20?! That's just too much for this game. Again, the multiplayer seems like it would work, but if you're playing with NPC's while the story limps around while passing out from alchohol poisoning every couple minutes, then it's simply not worth it. The music gets repetitive, and the characters are cardboard cutouts of a vauge stereotype, or typical character. "The Bad Guy", "The Bartender", and "That French Guy" are all you really get from these people.Don't buy this game, unless your friend want's to play it against you on multiplayer, because like I've said so many times already in this review: I can see the concept and gameplay being very entertaining when playing it against your friends. I wish I could delete it from my hours played, but now people now think I'm an expert at "The Ship", when I really don't like it.Don't buy it if you have no other friends that have it is my final choice. If it was 10, then I'd say go for it, the multiplyer seems fun from videos i've seen online, and it might be worth it! But, there are so many other great games for 20 on Steam. Go buy Portal 2,  or get a fancy hat in TF2 or something instead.

number of helpful: 17 of 40 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												I really do love the concept of this game. Pretty sure playing this game with friends would be awesome, but playing it on your own (as I do) is not much fun.When you buy this game, you get three files in your library:The first one is a tutorial, which consists out of the player standing in a bedroom and getting instructions. Nothing more.The second one is The Ship Single Player, which I really liked at first, but the lack of checkpoints make it rather tedious to complete.And last but certainly not least; The Ship, for your arcade and multiplayer desires. Arcade is pretty nice, though filled with AIs. I was expecting a real challenge when I started up my first multiplayer game, but I won it easily.Besides all of that, there are two more things I'd like to address.Firstly, I bought the game during a sale, and I think the price I paid was good. Looking at it off-sale and seeing it costing €20 (or €19,99 but cmon) kinda irks me. It's not a bad game, but not worth that much in my opinion.Secondly, if you buy the game, you get an extra 2 copies to gift to friends. If you gift a copy to a friend, said friend gets another copy to gift, thus creating a seeminly endless stream of copies, making it rather silly to buy the game for any price. Cheapskates unite ;DSo yeah, if you're looking for a fun game to play, I'd say get somebody to gift it to you give it a try! However, if you're looking for a challenge, you might want to keep looking.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												First off, this ♥♥♥♥ing game is broken. I don't care that there are guides to getting into servers. This game came out in 2006. For ♥♥♥♥s sake please fix this ♥♥♥♥ing server♥♥♥♥♥♥ I want to be able to play a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game without having to lead my friends through a maze of links and Steam guides. It's not as fun as you would think. Second, this game is frustrating. Everything about this game wants you to get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off. The map is ♥♥♥♥ing horrible. I cannot count the amount of times I have looked at it trying to find my quarry only to go the opposite direction. Your needs are annoying. The time in which you have to hunt your quarry is too short. And I'm not talking about custom servers. I mean the default settings. The combat is awkward. It comes down to clicking the attack button as fast as you can and pray ♥♥♥♥ING PRAY it doesn’t turn into an awkward affair. Getting more than three kills is unlikely.  The A.I is ♥♥♥♥ing abysmal (don't even consider single player). If you aren’t smart with your killing there is no way of winning. Oftentimes it is the player who kills the smartest that rules the map. Not the one with the most kills. The penalties for doing♥♥♥♥♥♥wrong are steep. Your quarry becomes unkillable if the ♥♥♥♥er decides to stand next to a guard. If you do try you are sent to jail for a minute or so giving you ample time to deal with your needs.  If you aren’t a retard with killing there are times in between rounds where you're doing ♥♥♥♥ing nothing waiting for the next round. The atmosphere is bland. It's like they were too lazy to go all the way with this roaring twenties aesthetic. Or they retextured normal ship interiors. That's the only explanation I can come up with for the fact that there are security cameras.  Animations are stiff but the models themselves succeed in their goal of being cartoonish. On the up side it's certainly different than a lot of other♥♥♥♥♥♥out there. It’s a good game concept wise. A murder dinner party game where you must take care of your needs while hunting your prey while being hunted yourself. Unfortunately it didn’t quite come together so well. A Steampunk themed sequel titled The Ship: Full Steam Ahead is listed on Steam Greenlight. Maybe it will be better whenever it comes out.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												This game is alright. It provides a solid [online] experience with well implemented mechanics and generally fun gameplay. But that's it. Expect nothing more than a very simple stealth/crime game that you play with your friends on occassion. On top of the meh gameplay experience, it seems the developers of this game have no idea what they're doing. It's highly overpriced at 20 dollars, and the only reason me and many other people even have this is because other people gave copies to us. If you want a simply basic fun game to play with friends then this is for you, but PLEASE only buy this during a sale.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2016
												F.E.A.R. First Encounter Assault Recon is a survival horror first-person shooter developed by Monolith Productions and published by Sierra Entertainment. It was released on October 17, 2005, for Microsoft Windows,[1] and ported by Day 1 Studios to the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3.[4] Timegate Studios has released two expansion packs, F.E.A.R. Extraction Point in October 2006,[5] and F.E.A.R. Perseus Mandate in November 2007. A direct sequel titled F.E.A.R. 2: Project Origin, was released in February 2009, and a second sequel, F.3.A.R., was released in June 2011, though it was developed by Day 1 Studios (now known as Wargaming Chicago-Baltimore), not by Monolith Productions.The game's story revolves around a supernatural phenomenon, which F.E.A.R.—a fictional special forces team—is called to contain. The player assumes the role of F.E.A.R.'s Point Man, who possesses superhuman reflexes, and must uncover the secrets of a paranormal menace in the form of a little girl.F.E.A.R. was well received by critics, scoring 89% on Game Rankings,[6] and The New York Times calling it "as thrilling and involving as Half-Life."[7] A "Director's Edition" DVD version of the game was also released. The DVD included a "Making of" documentary, a director's commentary, a short live-action prequel and the exclusive first episode of the promotional P.A.N.I.C.S. machinima. A related Dark Horse comic book was also packaged with the DVD. Along with the Director's Edition, F.E.A.R. Gold Edition was released. Gold Edition included the Director's Edition and Extraction Point. F.E.A.R. Platinum Edition features the original game and two expansion packs.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
Should I buy it?In short? YesThis game is largely a multiplayer PvP game, it has a single-player mode, but I haven't touched it. The premise of the game is pretty simple, you're a passenger on a boat, and you're engaging in a hunt. You've got a mark on your head, and you've got a target. Your goal? Kill your target before you're killed.There are many additional mechanics that hinder your progress. Certain weapons give more reward money, while others give less, these prices fluctuate. You can't be seen with your weapon out, or you'll get fined and incarcerated.On top of all this you'll also have to find your target, knowing only their last-seen location, and micro-manage your needs.The game is easy to pick up and play, but highly enjoyable and quite challenging. You definitely ought to pick it up.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												A fun murder game with a unique take on murder games (if any others exist.)My favorite mode is you are given the name of someone else to hunt, and you must track them down and kill them without arousing suspicion from them. At the same time, everyone else has been given someone else to hunt down (it could be you!) An optional system in the game is needs, which you must balance hunger, thirst, and other human needs with hunting.Overall, this game is extremely fun with other people, and buying the game includes two giftable copies to hand out to friends as well!

content:
Posted: June 16, 2013
												The live action role playing game "Assassin" in video game form!It's tonnes of fun and worth a play- BUT!!!!!! Theres a few things you need to know.1. The master servers are down and the company that currently own the rights don't want to fix it (they legally can't either). So to join online games, you're going to have to start sharing IP addresses or just have this at a LAN party. Better yet, just skip that and go LAN with this. That where this game shines best.2. Including your copy complete with Single Player (shithouse) and Tutorial (which is worth a look before you start playing) you get 2 additional copies of the game to send to your friends and then they each get 1 additional copy to give to their friends. So all in all you're paying $20USD for 5 copies of the game, which sounds alright if you want all 5 copies in the one LAN session but on it's own is pathetic.It's worth checking out if you're one of those gamers who wants to try something unique.

												A fun murder game with a unique take on murder games (if any others exist.)My favorite mode is you are given the name of someone else to hunt, and you must track them down and kill them without arousing suspicion from them. At the same time, everyone else has been given someone else to hunt down (it could be you!) An optional system in the game is needs, which you must balance hunger, thirst, and other human needs with hunting.Overall, this game is extremely fun with other people, and buying the game includes two giftable copies to hand out to friends as well!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												The Ship takes place on a cruise ship some time in the 1920s, where a number of unsuspecting passangers are forced to partake in Mr. Xs twisted game for his amusement.Players will be given a 'Quarry' Whom they must hunt down and  murder . But while you're hunting down your quarry, Someone else is hunting  YOU  down. But you can't simply shoot, shank, and bludgeon every last person who crosses path, because every kill that isn't your quarry or your hunter will incur a hefty cash penalty.Speaking of cash, there are plenty of shops, from clothing stores to food bars, and not only is cash going to be used in shops, but it's usually your goal to attain a certain amount of money in the ATM. How do you obtain this money you need? By murdering your quarry of course!But you're not just some main character who does what they like, you have needs! Hunger thirst, sleep, toiletry, cleanliness, entertainment, and social interaction are all obstacles for you to overcome whilst you try to murder people. If oyu don't know how to take care of these basic needs, then you MAY have failed as a human being.There are plenty of weapons, but if you think using the same weapon over and over is a good idea, you're wrong, for once a weapon is used, it goes to the bottom of the weapon list, and the longer a weapon goes unused, the more cash a quarry kill with it generates.The singleplayer sucks though, this is where it's at.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 30, 2014
												I bought this a while ago through the "Ship Compete Pack" and was pleasently suprised that it came with extra copies. Those were promptly sent to my friends and before long we were engaging in all sorts of wonderfully nailbiting hunts aboard Mr. X's shipThe legit "single player" version is ok, serving as more a tutorial than any real purpose. The real fun comes when you play The Ship against Bots, or better yet your friends in LAN Connectionthen the error came (and apparently im unique in this complaint)For some reason or another it decided that it doesnt even like THINKING about multiplayer, and will crash HARD whenever I tried to do so. So naturally I contacted publisher with a generic "WTF" email. The publisher took 3 weeks and only said words to the effect of "No clue whats going on, talk to steam". Then i contacted steam and was promptly advised to contact the publisherEven after uninstalling it, reinstalling it, CCcleaning it, reinstalling it 5 total times... it has yet to fix the crippling bugSo while the game provides unending fun in both bot mode and multiplayer mode, the issue i experienced (and its decided lack of help) makes me regretfully unable to reccomend this game

												I am very satisfied with the gameplay. If you like assasination and murder games, this is for you! Try and kill your quarry, but don't get caught! Also be careful your quarry doesn't kill you before you kill them. Don't kill anyone else but them, but remember, you're being hunted too! The only people you can kill besides your target are random noobs that attack you for absolutely no reason, and your hunter. This game is also hilarious when it comes to killing with all the interesting weapons! Whoever gains the most money in the end wins the hunt. But besides hunting, you have to take care of yourself too. You're only human. Eat, drink, bathe, entertain yourself, and do pretty much everything you would need to do in real life. It's like a combination of The Sims and murder games. Also, with your purchase you get TWO extra gifts to send to your Steam friends! Also, each friend who gets it will get yet another gift to send, but only one, not two. This game spreads like a plague! :P10/10Example of how this game gives you a smashin' good time from my own experience: I set fire to a man and finished him with an axe. While he was peeing.

Posted: July 22, 2014
												A who's-the-killer game that largely goes unnoticed, and has very few active servers.  Despite this, just getting a copy of the game gives you TWO FREE copies to share with your friends.  For $1 and three keys (when the game is on sale), you can't go wrong with a purchase. Now go hunt down your target, stab them with a poisoned syringe and make them throw up.  Shoot your intended murder in the face with a Winchester.  Then blow up the next guy you see with a purse bomb, and start a group of people on fire with a flare gun.  Then to celebrate your victory you can pee and take a bath in the game.

												The premise is simple: you are trapped on a cruise ship by some rich♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥bag in a mask and given the name of the person you are supposed to kill, but beware, you are also being hunted. You have a decent arsenal of weapons to find throughout the environment in which to off your mark and the graphics, although dated, are surprisingly smooth given that the game was released in 2006. I have had ours of fun with this game and don't see myself getting bored anytime soon. Unfortunately the game isn't being updated any longer because the original devs (Outerlight) have disbanded, but there is a company that has bought the rights to the IP and plan on making a sequel from the ground up. So, good game; play it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 7, 2014
												The Ship is a combination of Assassin's Creed Multiplayer and The Sims. You need to hunt down and kill your given target, all the while not getting detected, or killed by another player and at the same time tend to your needs. This game can be pretty tense as you only have so much time to kill your target. You also need to bag as much money as possible; so you need to search for high money weapons. The amount of money you get for killing someone with a certain weapon varies. Some areas of a map are under surveillance so if you get caught you lose money, all your weapons and opportunities to kill your target. Other people will be out to get you too so keep watch, otherwise you lose everything in your inventory. Tending to your needs can be difficult as well; as you will spend a lot of time trying to find and kill your target. All of these gameplay mechanics make the game fairly tricky, but it is a good challenge and a very enjoyable game that I highly recommend.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												'The Ship' might be one of the most unique and fun multiplayer experiences yet. Want to know where Assasin's Creed's excellent multiplayer came from? Step right up. (Also, the servers DO work. Look up online how to connect to them. Although, the A.I is actually pretty good, so you'll still have fun playing with bots) Perplexingly, the game is split into three seperate games. One is the tutotial, one is the singleplayer, and the other is the multiplayer. Why these can't just be lumped into one baffles me, but it doesn't really matter. Play the tutorial first, uninstall it, play the singleplayer, uninstall it, then just play the multiplayer from then on. The tutorial is straightforward enough, and the singleplayer is occasionally funny, yet mostly underwhelming. It's useful as an extended tutorial however, as it helps you work out how to manage your 'needs' and seek your target. The multiplayer is where it's at. Anyone who's ever been on a cruise-ship knows it's the most boring place in the world and you'll most likely develop utter contempt for anyone who's stuck on this tiny floating hellhole with you. So turning the whole thing into a cartoonish Agathe Christie 'stab-em-up' is curiously delightful. The 'Deathmatch' mode might be the most civilised deathmatch in gaming, as you take a break from murdering everyone with an umbrella to sip some tea at the cocktail bar whilst classical music blares; barely drowning the sound of utter carnage. The graphics are basic yet effective. The level-design is surprisingly excellent, with there being many hidey-holes and secret passages. The game also utilises the Source Engine - which is one of the reasons why this game has aged so well, along with the unique gameplay. If you keep checking on BundleStars.com, this game often goes for 70p (about a dollar) and it's more than worth it.

The graphics of this game is gokd for its time and the gameplay is fun and strategic in a way. It is cheap and a good time passer or a fun game to play with your friends. 8/10
